item.title: Summary of our LOY paper
item.description: Intro Renal Cell Carcinoma Kidney Cancer: new cases and deaths 8th most common cancer. 64K new cases of kidney cancer each year in US; 15.6 per 100K; 3.8% of all new cases. 14.4K deaths; 3.9 per 100K; 2.4% of all cancer deaths. 74.1% surviving 5 years. 1.6% lifetime risk to be diagnosed. Median age at diagnosis: 64 Incidence is increasing but death rate and survival are improving. Kidney cancer incidence rates are highest in Europe, North America, and Australia and lowest in India, Japan, Africa, and China.
